content.question: Based on the model of ferritin synthesis presented in Figure 2, which of the following best describes the mechanism whereby iron most likely regulates ferritin production?

choices.label: Translation occurs under low intracellular iron concentration when the IRP recruits ribosomes to the ferritin mRNA.
Translation occurs under low intracellular iron concentration when the IRP stabilizes the stem-loop structure in the ferritin mRNA.
Translation occurs under high intracellular iron concentration when the IRP-iron complex dissociates from ferritin mRNA, permitting ribosomes access to the ferritin coding region.
Translation occurs under high intracellular iron concentration when the IRP-iron complex brings the 5Â¢ end of the mRNA closer to the ferritin coding region.

content.answer: Translation occurs under high intracellular iron concentration when the IRP-iron complex dissociates from ferritin mRNA, permitting ribosomes access to the ferritin coding region.
